item.title: Trade waste covering pavement daily, 1st September
item.description:
Every day this stretch of pavement is covered with either tens of these bags, taking up at least half the pavement, or the disgusting detritus left over after collection. There are also regularly mattresses or other rubbish left by people attracted by the dump-like nature of this section of high street. The waste is likely coming from the shisha bar at 20-22 Camberwell Church St as legitimate waste in red Biffa bags, but it is not reasonable for our high street to be in such a state every day because of this one business. No other food or drink establishments on the street leave their waste like this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Camberwell Church Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reporting again, empty the bin, 1st September
item.description:
Another week where greenwich council is incapable of keeping the streets clean. I should not have to report this bin every time it’s full because it never gets emptied unless i do. It’s ridiculous. As well as Kelby Path still being a a jungle with so much weeds along the path/ stairs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelby Path, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights are facing in the wrong direction, 1st September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 398, Footscray Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Dog mess outside home, 1st September
item.description:
I have requested this before but the issue has not stopped as stencilling faded in first three to four weeks. I reported again and you closed my complaint and now this is the third time of reporting. Large big lumps of plastic o outside my front door of property on pathway my husband disabled and cannot see properly and he keeps walking in it. I need the stem king done so it remains there and doesn’t fade there is no stencilling there now it’s went in the first few weeks please someone listen. 07723366254
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Crescent, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
